title: Pinatubo hot fave to bolster two-year-old body of work in the Darley Dewhurst Stakes at Newmarket
text:
Pinatubo, Charlie Appleby’s unbeaten two-year-old, is one of 11 horses to stand their ground for Saturday’s Darley Dewhurst Stakes at Newmarket.

When Pinatubo won the Group One National Stakes by nine lengths on his latest start, he earned the highest rating for a juvenile since Celtic Swing. The form of the race was franked on Sunday when Armory, the distant runner-up, finished less than a length behind Victor Ludorum in third in Sunday’s Jean-Luc Lagardere at Longchamp and Pinatubo is already as short as 1-3 for Saturday’s race.

“He’s come out of the National Stakes in good shape and, as per usual, he’s been straightforward at home,” said Appleby yesterday. “I’d say he has frightened off most of the opposition but, from what we have seen at the races, he has been very impressive and improved with each run.

“It was great to see Earthlight win the Middle Park and he’s there as one of the potential champion two-year-olds but if Pinotubo wins the Dewhurst I think that [title] is signed, sealed and delivered.”

Aidan O’Brien, who does not appear to have a vintage crop of two-year-olds, has left five in the race, headed by Wichita. Clive Cox’s Solario winner Positive, who was beaten five lengths by Pinatubo at Goodwood, and Roger Varian’s Doncaster winner Molatham look the pick of the others.
